channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How China Powers Its Electric Cars and High-Speed Trains
item.description: China is building a network of ultrahigh-voltage power lines to carry solar and wind energy hundreds and even thousands of miles as few citizens dare ...

item.title: The W.N.B.A. Gets More Attention Now. That’s Not Always a Good Thing.
item.description: The league’s popularity has given rise to online sexism and racism — and misinformation that traffics in both.

item.title: Judge Signals She Is Likely to Order Abrego Garcia’s Release Soon
item.description: The judge expressed frequent frustrations with the Trump administration, saying it had presented a “totally inconsistent” case to keep the Maryland ma...

item.title: Trump to hike China tariffs to 130% and impose software export controls next month, as trade war reignites to nearly ‘Liberation Day’ levels
item.description: Trump said the U.S. will impose a 100% tariff on China "over and above any Tariff that they are currently paying."

item.title: The Trump Split Screen: A Peacemaker Abroad, a Retribution Campaign at Home
item.description: President Trump’s dueling personas were on display this week, providing endless ammunition to his allies and his enemies alike.

item.title: María Corina Machado of Venezuela Is Awarded the Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: The Norwegian Nobel Committee praised “her tireless work promoting democratic rights.” Ms. Machado, who built one of Venezuela’s most important politi...

item.title: Clark Olofsson, 78, Dies; Bank Robber Helped Inspire ‘Stockholm Syndrome’
item.description: In a 1973 heist, he and another man held hostages who surprisingly came to defend them, drawing attention to a puzzling psychological phenomenon.

item.title: Strikes on Venezuelan Boats Prompt Rare U.N. Meeting on the United States
item.description: The U.N. Security Council met Friday to discuss the Trump administration’s deadly attacks on what it asserts were drug smugglers in the Caribbean.

item.title: The A.I. Prompt That Could End the World
item.description: A destructive A.I., like a nuclear bomb, is now a concrete possibility; the question is whether anyone will be reckless enough to build one.

item.title: Map: 7.6-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes the South Atlantic Ocean
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Billionaire MacKenzie Scott doubles down on DEI with $42 million donation
item.description: In a signal to nonprofits and boardrooms, the Yield Giving philanthropist is backing diversity and equity with no‑strings grants—building on more than...

item.title: Lay’s drastically rebrands after disturbing finding: 42% of consumers didn’t know their chips were made out of potatoes
item.description: New bags—matte-ified and designed to look like wood planks (like a potato crate)—will hold the chips with revamped ingredient lists.

item.title: The U.S. and South Korea need to salvage their tariff and investment agreement—for the sake of the alliance
item.description: Seoul and Washington must see disagreements on investment and immigration as an opportunity to fine-tune a trade agreement they can both tolerate.

item.title: A 3-person policy nonprofit that worked on California’s AI safety law is publicly accusing OpenAI of intimidation tactics
